questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The major product formed in the following reaction is :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements : one is labelled as Assertion (A) and the other is labelled as Reason (R). 

Assertion (A) : Treatment of bromine water with propene yields 1-bromopropan-2-ol.

Reason (R) : Attack of water on bromonium ion follows Markovnikov rule and results in 1-bromopropan-2-ol.

In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :

option_texts.A: Both (A) and (R) are true but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A)
option_texts.C: Both (A) and (R) are true and (R) is the correct explanation of (A)

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The denticity of an organic ligand, biuret is :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements : one is labelled as Assertion (A) and the other is labelled as Reason (R).

Assertion (A) : Metallic character decreases and non-metallic character increases on moving from left to right in a period.

Reason (R) : It is due to increase in ionisation enthalpy and decrease in electron gain enthalpy, when one moves from left to right in a period.

In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :

option_texts.C: Both (A) and (R) are correct and (R) is the correct explanation of (A)
option_texts.D: Both (A) and (R) are correct but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A)

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Choose the correct name for compound given below :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements : one is labelled as Assertion (A) and the other is labelled as Reason (R) :

Assertion (A) : A simple distillation can be used to separate a mixture of propanol and propanone.

Reason (R) : Two liquids with a difference of more than 20$$^\circ$$ in their boiling points can be separated by simple distillations.

In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :

option_texts.B: Both (A) and (R) are correct but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A)
option_texts.D: Both (A) and (R) are correct and (R) is the correct explanation of (A).

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Which one of the following 0.10 M aqueous solutions will exhibit the largest freezing point depression?

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The structure of product C, formed by the following sequence of reactions is :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Consider the following cell reaction :

$$C{d_{(s)}} + H{g_2}S{O_{4(s)}} + {9 \over 5}{H_2}{O_{(l)}}$$ $$\rightleftharpoons$$ $$CdS{O_4}.{9 \over 5}{H_2}{O_{(s)}} + 2H{g_{(l)}}$$

The value of $$E_{cell}^0$$ is 4.315 V at 25$$^\circ$$C. If $$\Delta$$H$$^\circ$$ = $$-$$825.2 kJ mol$$-$$1, the standard entropy change $$\Delta$$S$$^\circ$$ in J K$$-$$1 is ___________. (Nearest integer) [Given : Faraday constant = 96487 C mol$$-$$1]

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The molarity of the solution prepared by dissolving 6.3 g of oxalic acid (H2C2O4.2H2O) in 250 mL of water in mol L$$-$$1 is x $$\times$$ 10$$-$$2. The value of x is _____________. (Nearest integer) [Atomic mass : H : 1.0, C : 12.0, O : 16.0]

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
The total number of reagents from those given blow, that can convert nitrobenzene into aniline is ___________. (Integer answer)

I. Sn $$-$$ HCl

II. Sn $$-$$ NH4OH

III. Fe $$-$$ HCl

IV. Zn $$-$$ HCl

V. H2 $$-$$ Pd

VI. H2 $$-$$ Raney Nickel

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: For a first order reaction, the ratio of the time for 75% completion of a reaction to the time for 50% completion is ____________. (Integer answer)

questions.question_text: The number of hydrogen bonded water molecule(s) associated with stoichiometry CuSO4.5H2O is ____________.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
According to the following figure, the magnitude of the enthalpy change of the reaction

A + B $$\to$$ M + N in kJ mol$$-$$ is equal to ___________. (Integer answer)

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Ge(Z = 32) in its ground state electronic configuration has x completely filled orbitals with ml = 0. The value of x is ___________.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: A3B2 is a sparingly soluble salt of molar mass M (g mol$$-$$1) and solubility x g L$$-$$1. The solubility product satisfies $${K_{sp}} = a{\left( {{x \over M}} \right)^5}$$. The value of a is _____________. (Integer answer)

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
The number of real roots of the equation 

$${e^{4x}} + 2{e^{3x}} - {e^x} - 6 = 0$$ is :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let f be a non-negative function in [0, 1] and twice differentiable in (0, 1). If $$\int_0^x {\sqrt {1 - {{(f'(t))}^2}} dt = \int_0^x {f(t)dt} } $$, $$0 \le x \le 1$$ and f(0) = 0, then $$\mathop {\lim }\limits_{x \to 0} {1 \over {{x^2}}}\int_0^x {f(t)dt} $$ :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let $$\overrightarrow a $$ and $$\overrightarrow b $$ be two vectors 
such that $$\left| {2\overrightarrow a  + 3\overrightarrow b } \right| = \left| {3\overrightarrow a  + \overrightarrow b } \right|$$ and the angle between $$\overrightarrow a $$ and $$\overrightarrow b $$ is 60$$^\circ$$. If $${1 \over 8}\overrightarrow a $$ is a unit vector, then $$\left| {\overrightarrow b } \right|$$ is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
The function 

$$f(x) = \left| {{x^2} - 2x - 3} \right|\,.\,{e^{\left| {9{x^2} - 12x + 4} \right|}}$$ is not differentiable at exactly :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Three numbers are in an increasing geometric progression with common ratio r. If the middle number is doubled, then the new numbers are in an arithmetic progression with common difference d. If the fourth term of GP is 3 r2, then r2 $$-$$ d is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Which of the following is not correct for relation R on the set of real numbers ?

option_texts.A: (x, y) $$\in$$ R $$ \Leftrightarrow $$ 0 < |x| $$-$$ |y| $$\le$$ 1 is neither transitive nor symmetric.
option_texts.B: (x, y) $$\in$$ R $$ \Leftrightarrow $$ 0 < |x $$-$$ y| $$\le$$ 1 is symmetric and transitive.
option_texts.C: (x, y) $$\in$$ R $$ \Leftrightarrow $$ |x| $$-$$ |y| $$\le$$ 1 is reflexive but not symmetric.
option_texts.D: (x, y) $$\in$$ R $$ \Leftrightarrow $$ |x $$-$$ y| $$\le$$ 1 is reflexive nd symmetric.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The integral $$\int {{1 \over {\root 4 \of {{{(x - 1)}^3}{{(x + 2)}^5}} }}} \,dx$$ is equal to : (where C is a constant of integration)

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
If p and q are the lengths of the perpendiculars from the origin on the lines,

x cosec $$\alpha$$ $$-$$ y sec $$\alpha$$ = k cot 2$$\alpha$$ and

x sin$$\alpha$$ + y cos$$\alpha$$ = k sin2$$\alpha$$

respectively, then k2 is equal to :

2x + y + z = 5

x $$-$$ y + z = 3

x + y + az = b

has no solution, then :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The length of the latus rectum of a parabola, whose vertex and focus are on the positive x-axis at a distance R and S (> R) respectively from the origin, is :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
If the function 
$$f(x) = \left\{ {\matrix{
   {{1 \over x}{{\log }_e}\left( {{{1 + {x \over a}} \over {1 - {x \over b}}}} \right)} & , & {x < 0}  \cr 
   k & , & {x = 0}  \cr 
   {{{{{\cos }^2}x - {{\sin }^2}x - 1} \over {\sqrt {{x^2} + 1}  - 1}}} & , & {x > 0}  \cr 

 } } \right.$$ is continuous 

at x = 0, then $${1 \over a} + {1 \over b} + {4 \over k}$$ is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: If $${{dy} \over {dx}} = {{{2^{x + y}} - {2^x}} \over {{2^y}}}$$, y(0) = 1, then y(1) is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: $$\mathop {\lim }\limits_{x \to 0} {{{{\sin }^2}\left( {\pi {{\cos }^4}x} \right)} \over {{x^4}}}$$ is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let [t] denote the greatest integer $$\le$$ t. Then the value of 

$$8.\int\limits_{ - {1 \over 2}}^1 {([2x] + |x|)dx} $$ is ___________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: A point z moves in the complex plane such that $$\arg \left( {{{z - 2} \over {z + 2}}} \right) = {\pi  \over 4}$$, then the minimum value of $${\left| {z - 9\sqrt 2  - 2i} \right|^2}$$ is equal to _______________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
If 'R' is the least value of 'a' such that the function f(x) = x2 + ax + 1 is increasing on [1, 2] and 'S' is the greatest value of 'a' such that the function f(x) = x2 + ax + 1 is decreasing on [1, 2], then 
the value of |R $$-$$ S| is ___________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
If the variable line 3x + 4y = $$\alpha$$ lies between the two 
circles (x $$-$$ 1)2 + (y $$-$$ 1)2 = 1 
and (x $$-$$ 9)2 + (y $$-$$ 1)2 = 4, without intercepting a chord on either circle, then the sum of all the integral values of $$\alpha$$ is ___________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The number of six letter words (with or without meaning), formed using all the letters of the word 'VOWELS', so that all the consonants never come together, is ___________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: If $$\left( {{{{3^6}} \over {{4^4}}}} \right)k$$ is the term, independent of x, in the binomial expansion of $${\left( {{x \over 4} - {{12} \over {{x^2}}}} \right)^{12}}$$, then k is equal to ___________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: An electric instrument consists of two units. Each unit must function independently for the instrument to operate. The probability that the first unit functions is 0.9 and that of the second unit is 0.8. The instrument is switched on and it fails to operate. If the probability that only the first unit failed and second unit is functioning is p, then 98 p is equal to _____________.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A helicopter is flying horizontally with a speed 'v' at an altitude 'h' has to drop a food packet for a man on the ground. What is the distance of helicopter from the man when the food packet is dropped?

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: In the following logic circuit the sequence of the inputs A, B are (0, 0), (0, 1), (1, 0) and (1, 1). The output Y for this sequence will be :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Two particles A and B having charges 20$$\mu$$C and $$-$$5$$\mu$$C respectively are held fixed with a separation of 5 cm. At what position a third charged particle should be placed so that it does not experience a net electric force?

option_texts.A: At 5 cm from 20 $$\mu$$C on the left side of system
option_texts.B: At 5 cm from $$-$$5 $$\mu$$C on the right side
option_texts.C: At 1.25 cm from $$-$$5 $$\mu$$C between two charges

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: An object is placed at the focus of concave lens having focal length f. What is the magnification and distance of the image from the optical centre of the lens?

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A coil having N turns is wound tightly in the form of a spiral with inner and outer radii 'a' and 'b' respectively. Find the magnetic field at centre, when a current I passes through coil:

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A body of mass M moving at speed V0 collides elastically with a mass 'm' at rest. After the collision, the two masses move at angles $$\theta$$1 and $$\theta$$2 with respect to the initial direction of motion of the body of mass M. The largest possible value of the ratio M/m, for which the angles $$\theta$$1 and $$\theta$$2 will be equal, is :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The masses and radii of the earth and moon are (M1, R1) and (M2, R2) respectively. Their centres are at a distance 'r' apart. Find the minimum escape velocity for a particle of mass 'm' to be projected from the middle of these two masses :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A small square loop of side 'a' and one turn is placed inside a larger square loop of side b and one turn (b >> a). The two loops are coplanar with their centres coinciding. If a current I is passed in the square loop of side 'b', then the coefficient of mutual inductance between the two loops is :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Choose the correct waveform that can represent the voltage across R of the following circuit, assuming the diode is ideal one :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A uniform heavy rod of weight 10 kg ms$$-$$2, cross-sectional area 100 cm2 and length 20 cm is hanging from a fixed support. Young modulus of the material of the rod is 2 $$\times$$ 1011 Nm$$-$$2. Neglecting the lateral contraction, find the elongation of rod due to its own weight.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Two plane mirrors M1 and M2 are at right angle to each other shown. A point source 'P' is placed at 'a' and '2a' meter away from M1 and M2 respectively. The shortest distance between the images thus formed is : (Take $$\sqrt 5 $$ = 2.3)

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:

    List - I

    Torque

    ML$$^{ 2}$$T$$^{ - 2}$$

    Surface Tension
    (iv)
    MLT$$^{ - 2}$$

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: For an ideal gas the instantaneous change in pressure 'p' with volume 'v' is given by the equation $${{dp} \over {dv}} =  - ap$$. If p = p0 at  v =0 is the given boundary condition, then the maximum temperature one mole of gas can attain is : (Here R is the gas constant)

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Which of the following equations is dimensionally incorrect?

Where t = time, h = height, s = surface tension, $$\theta$$ = angle, $$\rho$$ = density, a, r = radius, g = acceleration due to gravity, v = volume, p = pressure, W = work done, T = torque, $$\in$$ = permittivity, E = electric field, J = current density, L = length.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Angular momentum of a single particle moving with constant speed along circular path :

option_texts.A: changes in magnitude but remains same in the direction
option_texts.B: remains same in magnitude and direction
option_texts.C: remains same in magnitude but changes in the direction

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: In an ac circuit, an inductor, a capacitor and a resistor are connected in series with XL = R = XC. Impedance of this circuit is :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A moving proton and electron have the same de-Broglie wavelength. If K and P denote the K.E. and momentum respectively. Then choose the correct option :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Consider a galvanometer shunted with 5$$\Omega$$ resistance and 2% of current passes through it. What is the resistance of the given galvanometer ?

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
When a rubber ball is taken to a depth of __________m in deep sea, its volume decreases by 0.5%. 

(The bulk modulus of rubber = 9.8 $$\times$$ 108 Nm$$-$$2, Density of sea water = 103 kgm$$-$$3, g = 9.8 m/s2)

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A particle of mass 1 kg is hanging from a spring of force constant 100 Nm$$-$$1. The mass is pulled slightly downward and released so that it executes free simple harmonic motion with time period T. The time when the kinetic energy and potential energy of the system will become equal, is $${T \over x}$$. The value of x is _____________.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A square shaped wire with resistance of each side 3$$\Omega$$ is bent to form a complete circle. The resistance between two diametrically opposite points of the circle in unit of $$\Omega$$ will be ___________.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A wire having a linear mass density 9.0 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$4 kg/m is stretched between two rigid supports with a tension of 900 N. The wire resonates at a frequency of 500 Hz. The next higher frequency at which the same wire resonates is 550 Hz. The length of the wire is ____________ m.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The voltage drop across 15$$\Omega$$ resistance in the given figure will be ______________ V.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A block moving horizontally on a smooth surface with a speed of 40 ms$$-$$1 splits into two equal parts. If one of the parts moves at 60 ms$$-$$1 in the same direction, then the fractional change in the kinetic energy will be x : 4 where x = ___________.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
The electric field in an electromagnetic wave is given by E = (50 NC$$-$$1) sin$$\omega$$ (t $$-$$ x/c)

The energy contained in a cylinder of volume V is 5.5 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$12 J. The value of V is _____________ cm3. (given $$\in$$0 = 8.8 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$12C2N$$-$$1m$$-$$2)

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A capacitor of 50 $$\mu$$F is connected in a circuit as shown in figure. The charge on the upper plate of the capacitor is ______________$$\mu$$C.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A car is moving on a plane inclined at 30$$^\circ$$ to the horizontal with an acceleration of 10 ms$$-$$2 parallel to the plane upward. A bob is suspended by a string from the roof of the car. The angle in degrees which the string makes with the vertical is ______________. (Take g = 10 ms$$-$$2)
